intro: Lappula subcaespitosa, commonly known as the tufted lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, sparsely branched stems that often form a compact, herbaceous growth. The plant produces small, greenish to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its leaves are oblanceolate, with a rough texture and a bluish-green hue, often covered in fine hairs. Lappula subcaespitosa is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
